paper_title.en: Immobilization of Dyeing Sites to Polyethylene by Plasma Treatment

description.en: Polyethylene films were plasma treated for the purpose of affixing dyeing sites. A methanolic 10% solution of vinyl sulfonic acid (VSA) and polyethylene glycol diacrylate (PEGDA) were used to create a dyeing site-containing resin. Dipping the CF4 plasma pretreated low density polyethylene (LDPE) films in this solution, the films were then allowed to be penetrated for 22 hours at 75 degrees C and 0.2 MPa. After drying, the dyeing site-containing resin was fixed on the LDPE film by a further treatment with O-2 plasma. The fixation of the resin to LDPE films was confirmed by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS). From these analysis, the existence of the spectrum of -C-O and -C=O originating in PEGDA was confirmed. The presence of a sulfonic acid group of VSA was confirmed by observation of the S 2p orbital at 163.8 eV by XPS analysis. Dyeability of the functionalized LDPE films was confirmed by coloring with a cationic dye.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF PHOTOPOLYMER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

description.en: Polyethylene films were plasma treated for the purpose of affixing dyeing sites. A methanolic 10% solution of vinyl sulfonic acid (VSA) and polyethylene glycol diacrylate (PEGDA) were used to create a dyeing site-containing resin. Dipping the CF4 plasma pretreated low density polyethylene (LDPE) films in this solution, the films were then allowed to be penetrated for 22 hours at 75 degrees C and 0.2 MPa. After drying, the dyeing site-containing resin was fixed on the LDPE film by a further treatment with O-2 plasma. The fixation of the resin to LDPE films was confirmed by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR) and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS). From these analysis, the existence of the spectrum of -C-O and -C=O originating in PEGDA was confirmed. publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF PHOTOPOLYMER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.ja: ケミルミネッセンスと酸素吸収の関係に及ぼすポリマータイプ、安定剤、および資料形状の影響

paper_title.en: Synthesis and antioxidative properties of novel multifunctional stabilizers

description.en: New multifunctional stabilizers containing hindered amino, phosphite, and in some cases also free phenolic moieties have been synthesized starting from tris(diethylamino)phosphine. Some of them proved to be efficient stabilizers for model hydrocarbons and for polypropylene during processing, thermo-, and photooxidation. Various sterically hindered phenols, amines (HAS), and phosphites have been modified by the reaction with isophorone diisocyanate (IPDI) to get new multifunctional stabilizers for polymers. The synthesized products have been investigated regarding their thermal and antioxidative behavior. The novel urethane stabilizers are, depending upon their structure, decomposed gradually over a wide temperature range during the polymer processing to release the antioxidatively active parent phenols.

paper_title.en: Synthesis and antioxidative properties of novel multifunctional stabilizers

description.en: New multifunctional stabilizers containing hindered amino, phosphite, and in some cases also free phenolic moieties have been synthesized starting from tris(diethylamino)phosphine. Some of them proved to be efficient stabilizers for model hydrocarbons and for polypropylene during processing, thermo-, and photooxidation. The synthesized products have been investigated regarding their thermal and antioxidative behavior. paper_title.en: Interactions of stabilizers during oxidation processes

description.en:
The antioxidative action of mixtures of phenols, phosphites, HALS,(a)) and some of their transformation products in various compositions has been studied in the thermo- and photooxidation of hydrocarbons and polypropylene under different conditions. In the AIBN-initiated oxidation of hydrocarbons at low temperatures (< 80 degrees C), hindered phenols, hindered aryl phosphites and the nitroxyl derivatives of HALS act antioxidatively when used individually in appropriate concentrations. Secondary HALS do not show any induction period, but a certain retardation of the oxidation process after some reaction time. The inhibiting efficiency of nitroxyls observed cannot be explained completely by the currently accepted action mechanisms of HALS, but is also related to the reaction of the nitroxyls with alkylperoxyl radicals.
In mixtures with hindered phenols, HALS have almost no influence on the rate of thermooxidation at low temperatures. Their nitroxyl derivatives, however, always exhibit synergism, most pronounced when both stabilizers are used in equimolar ratios. During the photooxidation phenols lower the efficiency of HALS.
The influence of mixtures of stabilizers on the oxidative stability of polypropylene is rather different and depends on the oxidation conditions, the structure, the concentration and the ratio of the stabilizers. Synergistic as well as antagonistic effects are observed. Both aliphatic and aromatic phosphites studied act synergistically when used together and with phenols. This demonstrates that for acting as synergist for phenols, the hydrogen peroxide decomposing capability of the phosphites, but not their chain breaking activity is important. HALS-phosphites and phosphonites, containing amine and phosphorus units in one molecule, are highly effective inhibitors of photo- and thermooxidation and exhibit lower critical antioxidant concentrations and longer induction periods than phosphites alone. They even exceed the efficiency of phenols in many cases.
Transformation products of phenolic antioxidants investigated act differently and in many cases contrarily under photo- and thermooxidative conditions. Therefore, they influence the efficiency of stabilizer mixtures also in a different way.

paper_title.en: Interactions of stabilizers during oxidation processes

description.en:
The antioxidative action of mixtures of phenols, phosphites, HALS,(a)) and some of their transformation products in various compositions has been studied in the thermo- and photooxidation of hydrocarbons and polypropylene under different conditions. In the AIBN-initiated oxidation of hydrocarbons at low temperatures (< 80 degrees C), hindered phenols, hindered aryl phosphites and the nitroxyl derivatives of HALS act antioxidatively when used individually in appropriate concentrations. Secondary HALS do not show any induction period, but a certain retardation of the oxidation process after some reaction time. The inhibiting efficiency of nitroxyls observed cannot be explained completely by the currently accepted action mechanisms of HALS, but is also related to the reaction of the nitroxyls with alkylperoxyl radicals.
In mixtures with hindered phenols, HALS have almost no influence on the rate of thermooxidation at low temperatures. Their nitroxyl derivatives, however, always exhibit synergism, most pronounced when both stabilizers are used in equimolar ratios. During the photooxidation phenols lower the efficiency of HALS.
The influence of mixtures of stabilizers on the oxidative stability of polypropylene is rather different and depends on the oxidation conditions, the structure, the concentration and the ratio of the stabilizers. Synergistic as well as antagonistic effects are observed. Both aliphatic and aromatic phosphites studied act synergistically when used together and with phenols. This demonstrates that for acting as synergist for phenols, the hydrogen peroxide decomposing capability of the phosphites, but not their chain breaking activity is important. HALS-phosphites and phosphonites, containing amine and phosphorus units in one molecule, are highly effective inhibitors of photo- and thermooxidation and exhibit lower critical antioxidant concentrations and longer induction periods than phosphites alone. They even exceed the efficiency of phenols in many cases.
Transformation products of phenolic antioxidants investigated act differently and in many cases contrarily under photo- and thermooxidative conditions. Therefore, they influence the efficiency of stabilizer mixtures also in a different way.

paper_title.en: Cinnamic acid derivatives (part 1) proposal as new phenolic antioxidants

description.en: Cinnamic acid derivatives, especially esters, were examined as antioxidant in the autoxidation of styrene initiated by azo-bis-isobutyronitrile. A few o-hydroxy-cinnamic acid esters exhibited superior activities of antioxidants to 2,6-di-tert-butyl-4-methylphenol (BHT) which often is used as a standard substrate of phenolic antioxidants. In some cases, the rate constant kumh of a reaction between the ester and peroxy radicals was remarkably higher, for example, about 6 times higher than that of BHT. It was also found, furthermore, that the ester can arrest about four peroxy radicals, notwithstanding that BHT can trap, at highest, only two peroxy radicals. The alcoholic moiety of the ester little affected directly the activity as antioxidant. but the moiety provided a possibility to function as a light absorber similar to the one of benzophenone-type.

publication_name.en: Sekiyu Gakkaishi (Journal of the Japan Petroleum Institute)

paper_title.en: Hydrogenated benzoin photo-stabilizers (Part 1) substituted compounds for hindered amine light stabilizers

description.en: On basis of the discovery of hindered amine light stabilizers (HALS) and their derivatives that reduce photo-excited quinone to corresponding dihydroxy benzene, resulting in photo-stabilization of plastics, hydrogenated benzoins, which seem to have mobile hydrogens were molecular-designed as substitutes of HALS. The hydrogenated benzoins were found to work like HALS, limited to a few fundamentally characteristic properties. Such activities of non-substituted and 4,4′-dichloro-substituted hydrogenated benzoins were weaker than HALS, but the hydrogenated benzoins having 4,4′-dimethyl or 4,4′-dimethoxy substituents could retard autoxidation of styrene, at the beginning of the reaction, to the degree comparable to HALS. The nuclear substituents, having more electron-donating properties, were more effective for the activities of hydrogenated benzoins.

publication_name.en: Sekiyu Gakkaishi (Journal of the Japan Petroleum Institute)

paper_title.en: Cinnamic acid derivatives (part 2) relation between antioxidative activities and structures of cinnamic acid derivatives

description.en: The effect of positional relations of a hydroxyl group with an olefinic group on the antioxidative activity of a hydroxylated cinnamic acid ester was investigated, on the basis of a previous report that o-hydroxy-cinnamic acid esters exhibit, to a considerable extent, excellent activity, compared with 2.6-ditert-butyl-4-methyl-phenol (BHT). It was found that the ortho and para-positional relation of both groups is necessary for the development of antioxidative activities. This fact suggests that the stabilization of a phenoxy radical is important for function of the phenolic antioxidant. Substituents on the olefinic group provided in the place of an alkoxycarbonyl group of a cinnamic acid ester were thus investigated. They were divided into two groups: electron-attracting groups, such as cyano and methoxycarbonyl ones, being preferred. These substituents are thought to stabilize and localize the electron of a phenoxy radical on the olefinic group.

publication_name.en: Sekiyu Gakkaishi (Journal of the Japan Petroleum Institute)

paper_title.ja: Hydrogenated Benzoin Photostabilizers(2).Hydrogenated Benzoins Having Hydroxyl Substituents on Phenyl Groups
paper_title.en: Hydrogenated Benzoin Photo-stabilizers. (Part 2). Hydrogenated Benzoins Having Hydroxyl Substituents on Phenyl Groups.:Hydrogenated Benzoins Having Hydroxyl Substituents on Phenyl Groups

description.ja: ヒンダードアミン光安定剤 (HALS) は, プラスチックの安定化に良く使用される含硫黄添加剤と共用できない欠点を持っている。前報においてその欠点を有さない代替物として水素化ベンゾインを分子設計し, それがいくつかの基本的な特性においてHALSと同様の作用を有することを見い出した。しかし, これらの水素化ベンゾインの活性はHALSより弱かった。そこで本研究では, 水素化ベンゾインを高活性化し, さらに多機能化するために, ヒドロキシル基により核置換された3種の水素化ベンゾインを合成し, その性能評価をした。2,2'-ジヒドロキシおよび特に4,4'-ジヒドロキシ誘導体は単独で使用したとき, 優れたラジカル捕そく剤として作用した。4,4'-ジヒドロキシおよび特に3,3'-ジヒドロキシ誘導体は, HALSの機能, すなわちp-ベンゾキノンからのフェノール性化合物の生成をもたらす機能を表すキノンとの相乗作用において, HALSより優れた活性を示した。また, 2,2'-ジヒドロキシ誘導体はラジカル捕そく活性およびキノンへの水素供与能力がいく分低かったが, BHTとの相乗効果が大きく, またキノンへの水素供与後にベンゾフェノン型UV吸収剤と同様の化学構造を有するために, 光安定化剤としてさらに効果的に働くことが分かった。
description.en: Hindered amine light stabilizers (HALS) are handicapped in that they cannot be used together with sulfur-containing additives which are often utilized for the stabilization of plastics. In this study, three hydrogenated benzoins having hydroxyl substituents on phenyl groups were synthesized, in order to multi-functionalize hydrogenated benzoins, which were proposed as substitutes free of shortcomings of HALS. 2, 2'-Dihydroxy and, especially, 4, 4'-dihydroxy derivatives, worked solo as an excellent radical scavenger, while the effect of 3, 3'-dihydroxy derivative was unknown, attributed to lack of experimental data. 4, 4'-Dihydroxy and, especially, 3, 3'-dihydroxy derivatives exhibited higher abilities than HALS to give hydrogens to p-benzoquinone, resulting in the formation of corresponding phenolic compounds. 2, 2'-Dihydroxy derivative showed less activity to trap radicals and lower ability to give hydrogens to p-benzoquinone, but it was found that the product formed after the donation of hydrogens could work again as a photo-stabilizer, because its chemical structure is similar to that of benzophenone-type UV absorbers.

publisher.ja: 公益社団法人 石油学会

publication_name.en: Journal of The Japan Petroleum Institute

paper_title.en: Hydrogenated Benzoin Photostabilizers(1).Substituted Compounds for Hindered Amine Light Stabilizers
Cinnamic Acid Derivatives(2).Relation between Antioxidative Activities and Structures of Cinnamic Acid Derivatives
Hydrogenated Benzoin Photostabilizers(2).Hydrogenated Benzoins Having Hydroxyl Substituents on Phenyl Groups
Cinnamic Acid Derivatives(1).Proposal as New Phenolic Antioxidants
Inhibition of Autoxidation by Hindered Amine Light Stabilizers and Their Derivatives

description.en: The kinetics of radical trapping ability of a parent hindered amine light stabilizer (NH) (ADK Stab LA-77), its N-methylamine (NCH3), hydroxylamine (NOH) and nitroxide (NO) was investigated. The former three substrates can scavenge peroxy radicals, but the rate constants at 50°C are rather low (NH: 5.1×10 M-1.s-1,NCH3: 2.6×102M-1.s-1, and NOH: 5.1×0---102M-1.s-1 respectively), resulting in possible neglect of such ability compared with that of a typical phenolic antioxidant (ca. 1×104M-1.s-1). The nitroxide, on the other hand, trapped alkyl radicals at significant rapid rate (1.2×109M-1.s-1): the reaction is likely controlled by diffusion, and competes with oxygen, in terms of reaction with alkyl radicals. © 1994, The Japan Petroleum Institute. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of The Japan Petroleum Institute

paper_title.en: Interactions of the Hydroxylamine Derived from Bis-(2,2,6,6- tetramethyl-piperidinyl)-sebacate with Quinones

description.en: We have already proposed possible mechanisms of hindered amine light stabilizers (HALS), including the step in which HALS works as light stabilizer. This step consists of the regeneration of phenols, by reaction with a hydroxylamine of HALS, from benzoquinones derived from a phenolic antioxidant incorporated as radical scavenger. This paper provides clear evidences of the step, namely: benzoquinones are activated by UV light, resulting in the function as UV absorbers, and then are reduced by HALS, such as parent HALS and hydroxylamine, to form corresponding phenols such as hydroquinones. The reverse reaction of this step is also examined. In conclusion, actions of HALS, in practical use, are discussed on the basis of kinetic observations. © 1994, The Japan Petroleum Institute. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Journal of The Japan Petroleum Institute
